intro: Sebastiania venezolana, commonly known as the Venezuelan sebastiania, is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family. It is a shrub or small tree native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Venezuela and Colombia. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers clustered in cyathia, typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. Its fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds, and it often grows in moist, shaded environments. The plant has some ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated for its foliage.
